intro: Capparidastrum tenuisiliquum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed caper, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Capparaceae, which includes various species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Capparidastrum tenuisiliquum is typically found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in humid environments.
